value.0: <StartAction>[A shimmering apparition of a duergar stands in the center of the room. As you enter, he slowly turns to face you.]</Start>
What's this? Someone come into my cell? You're no golem, I can see that much. You're a real person, just like me. I mean, just like I used to be.
Trap? Ha-ha! This place is full of traps, all right. The Maker made sure of that. But I'm completely harmless.
Ha-ha! The Maker? No, I'm not the Maker.
My name is Gloignar. I was the Maker's assistant, before he went mad. As his sanity crumbled, his paranoia grew. He became convinced I was plotting against him.
To punish me, he disintegrated my body and bound my spirit in this room, making me a prisoner for all eternity. A fitting punishment for my imagined crimes, at least in his rotting mind.

I'm not a ghost in the normal sense. I have consciousness, but no real substance. My essence is spread across the material, ethereal and astral planes in such a way that I don't truly exist in any of them.
I'm trapped forever in a state between life and death, unable to leave this room. For five centuries I've been trapped here. But now that you have come, I have a chance to escape!
Wait, don't go! Please, you're the first person I've seen in five hundred years! You have to help me. I can make it worth your while. Just... just listen to me.
Do you think the Maker would let me escape that easily? I don't really exist on this plane. Not in any physical sense. Try to kill me if you want, but you'll just be wasting your time.
But it would be smarter if we worked together. If you help me, I can help you. What do you say, surfacer?
When the Maker imprisoned me here, he made sure that my salvation would always be just beyond my reach. Just one more way to torment and punish me for my imagined betrayal.
The key to my escape is a small stone known as a soul gem. It exists across multiple planes, as I do - though it is more firmly anchored in this plane, giving it a true physical existence.
All I need is for someone to bring me the soul gem from the pedestal behind me. Once in my possession, the spell binding me here will be broken. A simple task, but one I cannot do on my own.
I had hoped some of the Maker's golems would help me with this, but they can neither see nor hear me. My only hope was for an adventurer like you to stumble into this room.
If you set me free, I can help you to get to the lowest levels of this dungeon. That's where the Maker kept his most powerful possessions.
The entrance to the lowest level is protected by the Keeper, a powerful guardian. Free me and I'll give you the password to get by him. Then you can plunder the Maker's treasures at your will.
Good, surfacer. Please hurry. I've spent far too much time trapped in this room.
What reason would I have to lie, surfacer? I'm the one who has the most to lose, here. You can't imagine the horrors of being trapped in this room for five centuries.
Deekin hopes Boss never think that about him. Deekin loves Boss, even when Boss get mad. Uh... like now, maybe. Nice Boss. Good Boss.
I suppose that's to be expected, when you start working with a mad wizard.
I suppose that's to be expected, when you start working with a mad wizard.
I'm glad to see you came back, surfacer. You might be my last hope. So, are you ready to help me now? I can make it worth your while.
<StartAction>[As you turn away, the spirit lets out a pitiful cry.] </Start>Please don't go, surfacer. I'm begging you. Come back. We can help each other. Please, come back.
Welcome once again, surfacer? Do you have the soul gem that will release me from my terrible fate? Give it to me and I will give you the password to get by the Keeper.
<StartAction>[The spirit sighs.] </Start>I suppose I could answer a few questions for you, considering you're the only hope I have of ever being free.
Well, I know they can't see or hear me. Other than that, I can tell you very little. Most of the golems were created long after I was imprisoned.
It's possible the Maker succeeded in his experiments and finally created his 'perfect' golem, though I doubt it. He was quite mad when he locked me in here, and I imagine he only got worse.
I think it's more likely he just kept churning out golem after golem until the dungeon was overrun with his creations, each one a testament to his insanity and his failed experiments.
His real name was Alsigard. He was a powerful wizard, an archmage who knew more about creating golems than any before or since. A brilliant mind... but unfortunately not entirely stable.
He came to this island to pursue his goal of creating a perfect being. I came with him, leaving everything behind, never dreaming how far his madness would progress.
For fifty years he worked on his golems, but he could never create his perfect, flawless being. He accused me of sabotaging his experiments. That's when he imprisoned me here.
I don't know. He sealed off this room, and the power of his spell kept his golems from ever seeing or hearing me. In fact, you're the first person I've seen in the past 500 years.
I don't know what happened to Alsigard since then. Dead of old age? Killed by his own creations? Still alive down in the very depths of this dungeon? I really don't know.

<StartAction>[The spirit shakes his head.] </Start>Why should I do that? The password is my only bargaining chip, the only leverage I have. No, first you give me the soul gem, then you get the password.
The password to get past the Keeper is 'dragisla'. That's Alsigard, backwards. The Maker's name unmade. Simple, isn't it?

<StartAction>[The spirit takes the gem from you.] </Start>Thank you, surfacer. <StartAction>[The spirit begins to shimmer as the spell binding him begins to unravel.] </Start>The password is dragisla. That's Alsigard, backwards.
The Maker's name, unmade. So simple, isn't it? <StartAction>[The spirit's voice becomes fainter as his image begins to fade.]</Start>Free at last...

<StartAction>[The spirit takes the gem from you.] </Start>Thank you, surfacer. At last, I can finally be free.<StartAction>[ The spirit shimmers and begins to fade, before disappearing altogether.]</Start>
Back off! I'm not falling for any trap!
Are you the Maker?
Who are you?
I don't have time to chat with spirits.
So you're a ghost?
Goodbye.
This doesn't concern me.
I'll just kill you instead.
Make it quick.
What's in this for me?
I guess I could help you.
I'll be back once I get that soul gem.
How do I know I can trust you?
Escape? How?
I think I should just go.
What are you offering?
I want to ask you some questions first.
Do you know anything about the golems here?
Tell me about the Maker.
Where is the Maker now?
Give me the password, then you'll have your gem.
Here's the soul gem. <StartAction>[Pass him the soul gem from the pedastal.]</Start>

Comment.value: Script to make the ghost destroy himself
